URL¶

class bliss.saga.Url(url='')¶

The Url class as defined in GFD.90.

URLs are used in several places in the SAGA API: to specify service endpoints for job submission or resource management, for file or directory locations, etc.

The URL class is designed to simplify URL management for these purposes – it allows to manipulate individual URL elements, while ensuring that the resulting URL is well formatted.

Example:

# create a URL from user input
location = saga.Url (sys.argv[1])

d = saga.filesystem.Directory(location)

A URL consists of the following components (where one ore more can be ‘None’):

<scheme>://<user>:<pass>@<host>:<port>/<path>?<query>#<fragment>

Each of these components can be accessed via its property or alternatively, via getter / setter methods.

Example:

url = saga.Url ("scheme://pass:user@host:123/dir/file?query#fragment")

# modify the scheme 
url.scheme = "anotherscheme"
print "host: %s" % url.host
print "scheme: %s" % url.scheme
print "path: %s" % url.path

# above is equivalent with  

url.set_scheme("anotherscheme")
print "host: %s" % url.get_host()
print "scheme: %s" % url.get_scheme()
print "path: %s" % url.get_path()
fragment¶

The fragment component of the URL. @type: str

get_fragment()¶

Return the ‘fragment’ component of the URL. @return: str

get_host()¶

Return the ‘host’ component of the URL. @return: str

get_password()¶

Return the ‘username’ component of the URL. @return: str

get_path()¶

Return the ‘path’ component of the URL. @return: str

get_port()¶

Return the ‘port’ component of the URL. @return: int

get_query()¶

Return the ‘query’ component of the URL. @return: str

get_scheme()¶

Return the ‘scheme’ component of the URL. @return: str

get_username()¶

Return the ‘username’ component of the URL. @return: str

host¶

The host component of the URL. @type: str

password¶

The password component of the URL. @type: str

path¶

The path component of the URL. @type: str

port¶

The port component of the URL. @type: int

query¶

The query component of the URL. @type: str

scheme¶

The scheme component of the URL. @type: str

set_fragment(fragment)¶

Set the ‘fragment’ component of the URL. :type fragment: str

set_host(host)¶

Set the ‘host’ component of the URL. :type host: str

Set the ‘password’ component of the URL. :type password: str

set_path(path)¶

Set the ‘path’ component of the URL. :type path: str

Set the ‘port’ component of the URL. :type port: int

set_query(path)¶

Set the ‘query’ component of the URL. :type path: str

set_scheme(scheme)¶

Set the ‘scheme’ component of the URL. :type scheme: str

set_username(username)¶

Set the ‘username’ component of the URL. :type username: str
